etymology.description: Originally written as 呂 (OC *ɡ·raʔ), phonetically borrowed for “I; give”; later a 亅 was added as a distinguishing mark and the form was heavily stylized.
etymology.interpretation: Meaning was borrowed for its sound from 呂, a classic jiajie (phonetic loan). To avoid confusion with 呂, scribes appended a hook-like 亅 and the graph gradually simplified into its present shape.

examples.chinese: 依法予以处罚(依法予以處罰)。
examples.english: Punishment will be imposed according to the law.

examples.chinese: 特此予以批准(特此予以批准)。
对违规者予以警告(對違規者予以警告)。
examples.english: A warning will be given to the violators.
